A **marilith**, &, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. Mariliths are [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") that can deal damage extremely quickly, and possess six attacks per move - two 2d4 primary weapon attacks and four 2d4 claw attacks.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [2.1 As pets](#As_pets)
  - [2.2 As a polyform](#As_a_polyform)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Like most demons, the marilith is randomly generated only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"); it is also a valid form for [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") that appear in other branches of the dungeon. Mariliths are also eligible for [gating](/wiki/Gating "Gating") by other major demons, and can generate as [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of chaotic [gods](/wiki/God "God") and the unaligned [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch").

A marilith appears in the courtyard of the temple within [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum").

## Strategy

Mariliths are dangerous foes to run into before Gehennom, and remain troublesome to face even once you are prepared for the depths of Hell - they have a stellar natural [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of -6 and 80 [MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and move at the same base [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") as you. Be well-armored and have your best weapons at the ready if one approaches: a blessed, [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") and/or well-enchanted weapon at around [Skilled](/wiki/Skilled "Skilled") level should do her in quickly.

### As pets

Mariliths make excellent [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") due to their six attacks and natural AC, which compensates for their inability to wear armor outside of [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") and a [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm") - though equipping them with powerful items and weapons is also much more straightforward as a result. Their other main drawbacks include their weakness to silver, [inediate](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate") diet and comparatively low HP; additionally, a marilith that is killed will not leave a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") to revive. Due to their high monster MR, gating them yourself is one of the more reliable methods for obtaining a tame marilith.

### As a polyform

Mariliths are even better as polyforms, though turning into one will break worn [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor"), and you are similarly restricted to boots, gloves and non-silver weapons. Fortunately, you can #[twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") as a marilith if your original role can, and the marilith's bare-handed melee attacks have the greatest chance of gating in other tame demons, which are also likely to be mariliths.

## History

The marilith first appears with most other major demons in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Marilith](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marilith "wikipedia:Marilith")***

The marilith originates from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they are depicted as serpentine demons with six arms and a humanoid; they are always female, and can wield up to six weapons simultaneously. Their appearance may take cues from Hindu folklore, whose deities and demons frequently possess multiple heads and arms; serpentine creatures such as the [Naga](/wiki/Naga "Naga") may also have multiple heads and/or limbs as well.

*Dungeons & Dragons* mariliths (also known briefly as "type V demons") are highly intelligent and disciplined, with a good sense for strategy, tactics and martial combat. They serve as commanders to demon hordes, with the rare ability to unite and coordinate the otherwise-chaotic beings. Mariliths favor longswords or scimitars and consider their weapons to be their most cherished possessions; they are also capable of casting illusions and charms among other spells, and can use their tails to lash and/or constrict their foes.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), chaotic gods may send you a tame marilith minion as a sacrifice gift from experience levels 22 to 27.

The marilith's low level works in the favor of [Dopplegangers](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)"), who can reliably turn into mariliths at experience level 7 and potentially gate in others with bare-handed attacks, though they only get 5 per move due to the lack of twoweapon skill; other races can also do so with [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control"). As in vanilla, gating via polyself is generally preferable if you want a tame marilith, since it can be done at a much lower level and minions cannot be given equipment like pets.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), at least two mariliths are placed in the same room as [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") and his [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") within the demon prince's lair when his level is generated; additional mariliths may be among the major demons generated in the fountain room at level creation.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [shalosh tannah](/wiki/Shalosh_tannah "Shalosh tannah") can spawn [strange larvae](/wiki/Strange_larva "Strange larva") that may quickly grow into mariliths and other major demons with organic equipment.

[Kary, the Fiend of Fire](/wiki/Kary,_the_Fiend_of_Fire "Kary, the Fiend of Fire") is a [unique](/wiki/Unique "Unique") marilith that has somewhat lower defenses, but has [cold](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance") along with two additional attacks that randomly occur in her routine - a 4d6 bearhug attack, and a spell randomly selected from a set of three that may [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") you, [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") you, or target you with a powerful blast of fire. Kary is the name originally given to the Marilith boss from the first *Final Fantasy* game in order to avoid potential copyright issues with *Dungeons & Dragons*, and her spells are based on her attack pattern from that game.

[Shaktari](/wiki/Shaktari "Shaktari") is a unique marilith [demon lord](/wiki/Demon_lord "Demon lord") that can only be encountered as a [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap") within the lair of [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon"). Shaktari originates from a 2nd Edition supplement for *Dungeons & Dragons* in issue #60 of *Dungeon* magazine, and is the Abyss-dwelling Queen of Mariliths.

## Encyclopedia entry

The marilith has a torso shaped like that of a human female,  
and the lower body of a great snake. It has multiple arms,  
and can freely attack with all of them. Since it is  
intelligent enough to use weapons, this means it can cause  
great damage.
